alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 04 at 9:17PM ChST until March 06 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST MONDAY FOR NORTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR NORTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON FOR EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 9 feet in the surf zone. Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...For the High Surf Advisory, north facing reefs. For the High Rip Current Risk, north and east facing reefs. * WHEN...Through early Monday morning, for north facing reefs. Through Monday afternoon, for east facing reefs. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
